This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Signed by Judge J. Arthur Melvin on 09/26/2022.
Laboratory report filed by the State.

9:14 AM Defendant Joel W Yochum in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul E Bucher in court for Joel W Yochum.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court acknowledges a plea questionnaire is on file.  State places offer on record. Defense confirms offer and advises a PSI will be requested and to have defendant remain in custody at Waukesha County Jail pending sentencing.  Court conducts colloquy with defendant.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 2, Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 1 and 3 are dismissed by operation of law.  Defense asks that State file the drug analysis after today's hearing.  Court will accept the verbal record made by Atty. Bucher.  Discussion made regarding PSI and scheduling of sentencing date.  Court revokes bail and orders defendant to remain in custody at Waukesha County Jail pending sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on November 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Hearing on September 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:25 AM Defendant Joel W Yochum in court, in custody, with attorney Paul E Bucher.   Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Village of Pewaukee Police Department Officer Erik Michalsen sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Campbell.  Cross examination by Attorney Bucher.  State rests.  State moves for bind over with argument.  Attorney Bucher objects to bind over with argument and moves to dismiss.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to have no contact with individual listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring  through WCS.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.
